Tucson had done his job successfully, and turns off his sonar emitter.  Str=
aight Shot taps Perceptor on the shoulder as promised, to signal that Tucso=
n had turned off his sonar emitting device.  Now, there was the threat of a=
 cave in to deal with. Tucson Prime had to think fast if he was to get ever=
yone out of that part of the tunnel unharmed.  He accelerates to attempt a =
near escape.

"Hang on, things are about to get a little bumpy!"

Quickstri=
de spots an open hatch in Tucson's cab.  He signals to Talon to follow him =
in.

" Talon, Legacy, I think he wants us in the cab."

Straight Shot waits=
 for Perceptor to turn back on his audio sensors, and finds herself holding=
 onto him in a bit of a fright reflex.  She wasn't scared of much of anythi=
ng but this situation was terrifying her.  Her body trembles.

"Oohhh I so =
hope you know what you're doing Tucson!"

Tucson replies.

" I'm not sure i=
f it's the right thing, but it has to be done.  We aren't leaving Rodimus b=
ehind."

Straight Shot realizes that he's right, and watches the way ahead =
inside at the driver's side seat.

" No, we can't.  Let's hope he's still f=
unctioning."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus=
@...> wrote:
>
> Who: LEGACY, Tuscon, Perceptor, Talon, Straight Shot, Quic=
kstride
> Location: Deep Earth caverns not far from the Black Fortress
> 
>=
 > "Woahh, a little more pest control than I bargained for! Legacy, Talon, =
you two okay?!"
> 
> Legacy quickly looked around the battlefield, noting t=
he somewhat
> diminished number of combatants, "I am undamaged." he said in=
 his
> typically cold tones as he continued to attempt to pick off some of
=
> the enemy.
> 
> > Straight Shot too, finds herself firing off arrows just=
 to try and slow the insect beings down, while she desperately tries to hel=
p Perceptor.
> >
> > "Perceptor, I need you to turn off your audio sensors =
for a short time. I'm going to attempt a sonar blast which I hope will slow=
 things down for us enough to get to Rodimus. That way I know I will not ha=
rm you when I do emit this attack. Straight Shot, when I'm through doing th=
at, tap him on the shoulder to let him know it's safe to turn them back on.=
"
> 
> As the alien insectoid menace of 5 continued to advance, the next
> =
round of combat began!
> 
> Tuscon gave orders to Perceptor to shut down hi=
s audio receptors, and
> thereby holding his attack.
> 
> Perceptor, desper=
ately tried to turn off his receptors, and as if like
> a switch had been t=
hrown his whole world went dark as his sensors
> which in many ways relied =
on hearing was short down. He could still
> smell the attacking creatures a=
pproach, but in no way would this sense
> of smell allow him to fire under =
battle conditions.
> 
> Seeing that Perceptor had successfully went dark he=
 let loose with his
> sonic discharge, sending wave after disruptive wave i=
nto the tunnel!
> 
> For a moment the insectoid creatures looked at Tuscon =
as a strange
> sort of intelligence flashed through their optics before eac=
h one, one
> by one slumped over, victims of his attack. They all fell into=
 stasis
> lock.
> 
> However at the same time, due perhaps to the wide area=
 sonic attack,
> the walls themselves around the group began to rumble and =
shake as
> bits of stone and debris began to fall from the ceiling.
> 
> Al=
though Perceptor could not see or hear, his vibrational sensors and
> his d=
igger's instincts told him one thing: CAVE IN!!!!!
>

ous about having characters doing a lot in your
